author: chfast
content: RLP is not necessary in this context. Simply bytes concatenation will do. There is only single use case of RLP in EVM: `CREATE` address derivation. Even `CREATE2` doesn't use RLP. EIP-7702 adds the second use-case.

author: _shemnon
content: ChainID is variable length and nonce is optional, so that makes an encoding preferable.  However all the data can be pulled from the transaction so a concatenation, even with the optional nonce, may produce the results we want. While I don't see a direct way to reliably exploit it, the concatenation may be subject to extension attacks if we don't encapsulate the components somehow, which RLP accomplishes.
